publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1113# Trish Godman: Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women-That the Parliament commends the recent decision of Amnesty International to conduct a sustained campaign to stop violence against women; agrees with Amnesty International that violence against women is deeply embedded in all nations, including our own and that it is found in all social classes, irrespective of income, education or religion; notes with serious concern the prevailing incidence of domestic violence and other forms of violence against women in Scotland; reminds the Scottish Executive, local authorities and the police forces of their legal and moral obligations to protect women from violence, and considers that the Executive should do all in its power to eliminate this vile abuse of human rights in Scotland and to assist, where it can, the international campaign to stop violence against women.
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Jackie Baillie*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Michael Matheson*

S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Fiona Hyslop*, Scott Barrie*, Kate Maclean*, Eleanor Scott*, Christine May*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Helen Eadie*, Maureen Macmillan*, Johann Lamont*, Margaret Jamieson*, Shiona Baird*, Alex Neil*, Stewart Stevenson*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Susan Deacon*, Mike Watson*, Tricia Marwick*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Karen Gillon*, Pauline McNeill*, Carolyn Leckie*

S2M-1113# Trish Godman: Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women-That the Parliament commends the recent decision of Amnesty International to conduct a sustained campaign to stop violence against women; agrees with Amnesty International that violence against women is deeply embedded in all nations, including our own and that it is found in all social classes, irrespective of income, education or religion; notes with serious concern the prevailing incidence of domestic violence and other forms of violence against women in Scotland; reminds the Scottish Executive, local authorities and the police forces of their legal and moral obligations to protect women from violence, and considers that the Executive should do all in its power to eliminate this vile abuse of human rights in Scotland and to assist, where it can, the international campaign to stop violence against women. Supported by: Jackie Baillie, Michael Matheson, Fiona Hyslop, Scott Barrie, Kate Maclean, Eleanor Scott, Christine May, Mr Bruce McFee, Christine Grahame, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Helen Eadie, Maureen Macmillan, Johann Lamont, Margaret Jamieson, Shiona Baird, Alex Neil, Stewart Stevenson, Nicola Sturgeon, Susan Deacon, Mike Watson, Tricia Marwick, Mike Pringle, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Karen Gillon, Pauline McNeill, Carolyn Leckie, Bill Butler*, Des McNulty*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Linda Fabiani*, Marlyn Glen*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Dennis Canavan*, Mark Ballard*

S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Elaine Smith*, Ms Sandra White*, Murray Tosh*, Robin Harper*, Chris Ballance*, Patrick Harvie*, Frances Curran*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Tommy Sheridan*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Cathie Craigie*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) John Swinburne*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Sarah Boyack*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-1113# Amnesty International's Campaign to Stop Violence Against Women (lodged on 29 March 2004) Rosie Kane*
